Detailed Description

Wrapper class around the C++ logging system. Provides log services by channel and severity.

Member Function Documentation

◆ GetSeverityLowerBound() [1/2]

LogSeverity IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::GetSeverityLowerBound ( )
static

Determines the lowest severity level (if any) that the global logger will accept.

This is a convenience function for IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::GetSeverityLowerBound(String^ msChannelName) that provides nullptr for the channel name (msChannelName).

Returns
Returns the lowest severity level that the logger will accept for the given channel (if provided). If msChannelName is set to nullptr, then all channels are considered.

If the logger will accept any severity level, then this function will return the lowest defined severity level, which is SEV_TRACE.

If the provided channel is not registered with the loggger, meaning that the logger does not write any logs to the channel, then the lowest severity level cannot be determined and SEV_INVALID is returned.

◆ GetSeverityLowerBound() [2/2]

LogSeverity IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::GetSeverityLowerBound ( String^  msChannelName)
static

Determines the lowest severity level (if any) that the global logger will accept.

Parameters
[in]msChannelNameThe optional channel name to use for determining the lowest severity level for. If this is set to nullptr, then all channels are considered.
Returns
Returns the lowest severity level that the global logger will accept for the given channel (if provided). If msChannelName is set to nullptr, then all channels are considered.

If the global logger will accept any severity level, then this function will return the lowest defined severity level, which is SEV_TRACE.

If the provided channel is not registered with the global loggger, meaning that the logger does not write any logs to the channel, then the lowest severity level cannot be determined and SEV_INVALID is returned.

If there is no global logger set, meaning that logging is disabled altogether, then SEV_INVALID is returned.

◆ GetSingleton()

LogBase IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::GetSingleton ( )
static

Gets the global logger instance being used in all calls to the ISLog static interface.

See also
IonicSecurity::Logger::Log::SetSingleton(LogBase^ pLogger)
Returns
Returns the currently set logger instance pointer. Note that it may be NULL.

◆ LogData() [1/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::LogData ( LogSeverity  eSeverity,
String^  msChannelName,
int  nLine,
String^  msFile,
String^  msData 
)
static

Passes the log entry to the logger singleton.

Parameters
[in]eSeverityThe severity level of the log entry.
[in]msChannelNameThe channel name to write through. This channel should be registered into one or more sinks in the JSON configuration.
[in]nLineThe line number of the calling code.
[in]msFileThe file name or file path of the calling code.
[in]msDataThe log message string.

Writes a log using the message string provided by msData. The log inputs are passed to the LogBase singleton (if any) set by using IonicSecurity::Logger::Log::SetSingleton(LogBase^ pLogger). These should typically be avoided and severity based log functions should be called instead (e.g. LogError("Channel", "Log error string."))

◆ LogData() [2/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::LogData ( LogSeverity  eSeverity,
String^  msChannelName,
String^  msData 
)
static

Adds the calling filename and line number to the log message.

Parameters
[in]eSeverityThe severity level of the log entry.
[in]msChannelNameThe channel name to write through. This channel should be registered into one or more sinks in the JSON configuration.
[in]msDataThe log message string.

Writes a log using the message string provided by msData. The filename and line number if the caller. These should typically be avoided and severity based log functions should be called instead (e.g. LogError("Channel", "Log error string."))

◆ LogDebug() [1/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::LogDebug ( String^  msChannelName,
String^  msData 
)
static

Writes a log entry, with Debug level severity, using the message string provided by msData, to the channel as defined by msChannelName.

Parameters
[in]msChannelNameThe channel name to write through. This channel should be registered into one or more sinks in the JSON configuration.
[in]msDataThe log message string.

Writes a log using the message string provided by msData. The log inputs are passed to the LogBase singleton (if any) set by using IonicSecurity::Logger::Log::SetSingleton(LogBase^ pLogger).

◆ LogDebug() [2/2]

void IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::LogDebug ( String^  msChannelName,
String^  msFormat,
...array< Object^> ^  args 
)
static

Writes a log entry, with Debug level severity, using the message string provided by msData, to the channel as defined by msChannelName.

Parameters
[in]msChannelNameThe channel name to write through. This channel should be registered into one or more sinks in the JSON configuration.
[in]msFormatThe Console::WriteLine-style format string (e.g. "Print this string {0} and this integer {1}").
[in]...argsVariable number of inputs to be used in conjunction with msFmt (same usage as Console::WriteLine()).

Writes a log using the message string provided by msData. The log inputs are passed to the LogBase singleton (if any) set by using IonicSecurity::Logger::Log::SetSingleton(LogBase^ pLogger).

◆ SetSingleton()

LogBase IonicSecurity::SDK::Log::SetSingleton ( LogBase^  pLogger)
static

Sets the global logger instance to use in all calls to the ISLog static interface.

Parameters
[in]pLoggerLogger instance.
Returns
Returns a pointer to the previously set logger. If none was set, a NULL pointer is returned.
See also
IonicSecurity::Logger::Log::GetSingleton()

This function sets the global logger instance to use in all calls to the IonicSecurity::Logger::Log static interface. Any previously set singleton will NOT be deleted or notified of the change. It is valid to set the instance to NULL, in which case all subsequent logging will cease.
